subsection.leadIn: In this Regulation, unless the context otherwise requires—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to Part II, means an exemption certificate issued under section 5(1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to Part III, means an exemption certificate issued under section 16(1);

subsection.def: existing member (現有成員), in relation to an ORSO exempted scheme or ORSO registered scheme, means a relevant employee who became a member of the scheme before or on the relevant date;
mandatory condition (強制性條件) means a condition referred to in section 17(1)(b);
new eligible employee (新的有資格僱員), in relation to an ORSO exempted scheme or ORSO registered scheme, means a relevant employee who is, or will become, eligible to be a member of the scheme;
new member (新成員), in relation to an ORSO exempted scheme or ORSO registered scheme, means a new eligible employee who became a member of the scheme after the relevant date;
original schemes (原來的計劃), in relation to an ORSO registered scheme, means 1 or more relevant ORSO registered schemes referred to in section 14(1);

def.name: ORSOExemptedScheme
def.leadIn: ORSO exempted scheme (職業退休豁免計劃) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an exempted scheme within the meaning of section 2 of the relevant Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an occupational retirement scheme within the meaning of the relevant Ordinance where the employer of the scheme is the government of a place outside Hong Kong or an agency or undertaking of or by such a government which is not operated for the purpose of gain;

subsection.def: ORSO registered scheme (職業退休註冊計劃) means a registered scheme within the meaning of section 2 of the relevant Ordinance;
past service liability (過去服務負債) has the same meaning as in section 2 of the relevant Ordinance; (29 of 2002 s. 14)
relevant date (有關日期) means the date on which section 7 of the Ordinance comes into operation*;

def.name: RelevantEmployer
def.leadIn: relevant employer (有關僱主), in relation to an ORSO exempted scheme or ORSO registered scheme—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means the employer who provides the employment which entitles or enables the relevant employee to be a member of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b

subsection.def: relevant Ordinance (有關條例) means the Occupational Retirement Schemes Ordinance (Cap. 426);

def.name: RelevantORSORegisteredScheme
def.leadIn: relevant ORSO registered scheme (有關職業退休註冊計劃) means an ORSO registered scheme—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which is governed by a trust;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which provides benefits payable on termination of service, death, disability, retirement or winding up of the scheme;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: established before or on 15 October 1995; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in respect of which an application under section 7 or 15 of the relevant Ordinance was received by the Registrar within the meaning of that Ordinance not later than 15 January 1996; (E.R. 4 of 2019)

subsection.def: vested benefit (既有利益) has the same meaning as in section 2 of the relevant Ordinance. (29 of 2002 s. 14)

subsection.content: An ORSO registered scheme to which a certificate issued under section 14(1) relates shall be deemed to be a relevant ORSO registered scheme, and the provisions of the Ordinance and the other provisions of this Regulation shall apply accordingly.

For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that the provisions of this Regulation shall apply to and in relation to an ORSO registered scheme where there is no contract of employment between a member of the scheme and a person who makes contributions to the scheme on behalf of the member in the same way as the provisions of this Regulation apply to and in relation to an ORSO registered scheme where there is a contract of employment between a member of the scheme and the person who makes contributions to the scheme on behalf of the member.

subsection.leadIn: Where an existing member of an ORSO exempted scheme, or of an ORSO registered scheme, (original scheme) the subject of an exemption certificate is transferred to another scheme (new scheme) where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the new scheme is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an ORSO registered scheme the subject of an exemption certificate; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the subject of a certificate referred to in section 14(1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the new scheme is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: operated by the same employer; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an ORSO exempted scheme, or an ORSO registered scheme, the subject of an exemption certificate;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the new scheme is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: operated by a different employer in the circumstances specified in section 70A(6)(a) of the relevant Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an ORSO exempted scheme, or an ORSO registered scheme, the subject of an exemption certificate; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the new scheme is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: operated by an associated company in the circumstances specified in section 70A(6)(b) of the relevant Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an ORSO exempted scheme, or an ORSO registered scheme, the subject of an exemption certificate,

subsection.continued: then the member shall be treated as an existing member of the new scheme if—

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: no benefits have been or are to be paid under the original scheme to the existing member as a result of the transfer;

paragraph.name: f
g
paragraph.content: the value of vested benefit and the value of past service liability in respect of benefit entitlement conferred by or to be conferred by the new scheme to the existing member at the time immediately after the transfer will not, as a result of the transfer, be less than the value of vested benefit and the value of past service liability respectively of the member under the original scheme immediately before the transfer;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the period of employment of the existing member during which he is a member of the original scheme is recognized under the new scheme; and

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: in any case where section 70A(6)(a) or (b) of the relevant Ordinance is applicable to the transfer, that section has been complied with and no benefits held in an occupational retirement scheme in respect of the person have been paid in accordance with section 70A(6) of the relevant Ordinance to the person or the previous owner or the company concerned. (29 of 2002 s. 14)

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application
section.leadIn: This Regulation shall not apply to or in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any employment which does not entitle or enable a relevant employee to be a member of an ORSO exempted scheme or relevant ORSO registered scheme;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any relevant income derived from such employment.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Existing members and new eligible employees to elect between ORSO exempted scheme and MPF scheme

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (5) and (6), the relevant employer of an ORSO exempted scheme shall, as soon as practicable after making an application under section 5—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an existing member, not later than—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: 50 days before the relevant date; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: 10 days after he became a relevant employee,

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a new eligible employee, not later than 10 days after the employee became such an employee,

subsection.continued: provide the member or employee, as the case may be, with, subject to subsection (8), the information specified in Part 1 of Schedule 1 in relation to—

paragraph.leadIn: the ORSO exempted scheme; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the MPF scheme which the member or employee, as the case may be, is entitled or enabled to become a member thereof by virtue of his employment,

subsection.continued: in the Chinese and English languages.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (5), an existing member shall give notice in writing to the relevant employer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: not later than 30 days—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: before the relevant date; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: after he became a relevant employee,

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: advising the employer that the member elects—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to remain as a member of the ORSO exempted scheme; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to become a member of the MPF scheme.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (6), a new eligible employee shall give notice in writing to the relevant employer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: not later than 30 days after the employee became such an employee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: advising the employer that the employee elects to become a member of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the ORSO exempted scheme; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the MPF scheme.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (7), an existing member or new eligible employee who fails to make an election under subsection (2) or (3), as the case may be, within the period prescribed under that subsection shall be deemed to have elected to become a member of the MPF scheme and, in any such case, the provisions of the Ordinance and the other provisions of this Regulation shall apply accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (1) and (2) shall not apply in the case of an existing member of the ORSO exempted scheme who is required by an enactment of a place outside Hong Kong to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: remain as a member of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make contributions to the scheme in relation to his employment by the relevant employer of the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (1) and (3) shall not apply in the case of a new eligible employee who is required by an enactment of a place outside Hong Kong to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: become a member of the ORSO exempted scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make contributions to the scheme in relation to his employment by the relevant employer of the scheme.

subsection.content: Subsection (4) shall not apply in the case of an existing member or new eligible employee to which subsection (2) or (3), as the case may be, does not apply by virtue of subsection (5) or (6) respectively.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, subject to such conditions as the Authority thinks fit, by notice in writing (published in such manner as the Authority thinks fit) waive or modify any of the provisions of Part 1 of Schedule 1 in the case of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a particular ORSO exempted scheme specified in the notice;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an ORSO exempted scheme belonging to a class of ORSO exempted schemes specified in the notice;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a particular relevant employer specified in the notice; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a relevant employer belonging to a class of relevant employers specified in the notice.

subsection.content: The Authority may on an application in writing issue an exemption certificate to the relevant employer in respect of an ORSO exempted scheme if the Authority is satisfied that the application and the scheme comply with the requirements of or under this Regulation which are applicable to the application or scheme, as the case may be.

subsection.leadIn: An application under this section shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made by the relevant employer of the ORSO exempted scheme;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: made in such form as may be specified by the Authority;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: accompanied by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the prescribed fee; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: such information or documents (including statutory declarations) as may be specified by the Authority; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: made before the specified date.

subsection.content: Where the Authority receives an application under this section, the Authority may require the applicant to supply to the Authority such information or documents (including a legal opinion on a matter specified by the Authority) as the Authority shall specify which is reasonably required to enable him to determine the application.
Where the Authority refuses an application for an exemption certificate, he shall give notice in writing of the refusal to the applicant and the notice shall state the reason for the refusal.

An appeal under section 35 of the Ordinance against a decision of the Authority to refuse an application for an exemption certificate may be made by the applicant within 2 months after the date on which the notice concerned under subsection (4) is given.

def.name: SpecifiedDate
def.leadIn: In this section, specified date* (指明日期) means a date specified by the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by notice in the Gazette; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purposes of this section.

editorialNote.content: * Specified date: 4 May 2000—see Cap. 485 sub. leg. D.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Effect of exemption certificate
section.content: Without prejudice to the operation of section 3, the effect of an exemption certificate is that the existing members and new members of the ORSO exempted scheme to which the certificate relates, and the relevant employer of the scheme, are each exempt from Part 3 of the Ordinance.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Action to be taken by relevant employer to whom exemption certificate has been issued
section.leadIn: The relevant employer to whom an exemption certificate has been issued shall, as soon as is practicable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: cause the certificate to be exhibited at all times in a conspicuous position at—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: his principal office in Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if there is no such office, each premises where a member of the ORSO exempted scheme to which the certificate relates is employed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide each member of the scheme with a copy of the certificate.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Withdrawal of exemption certificate on application by relevant employer

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may on an application in writing withdraw an exemption certificate where the Authority is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the grounds for withdrawal warrant the withdrawal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the certificate is withdrawn, the relevant employer of the ORSO exempted scheme to which the certificate relates will not thereby be in breach of the provisions of the Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: An application under this section shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made by the relevant employer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state the grounds for making the application;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be made in such form as may be specified by the Authority; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: be accompanied by such information or documents (including statutory declarations) as may be specified by the Authority.

subsection.content: Where the Authority receives an application under this section, the Authority may require the applicant to supply to the Authority such information or documents (including a legal opinion on a matter specified by the Authority) as the Authority shall specify which is reasonably required to determine the application.
Where the Authority refuses an application to withdraw an exemption certificate, he shall give notice in writing of the refusal to the applicant and the notice shall state the reason for the refusal.

An appeal under section 35 of the Ordinance against a decision of the Authority to refuse an application to withdraw an exemption certificate may be made by the applicant within 2 months after the date on which the notice concerned under subsection (4) is given.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Action to be taken by relevant employer where exemption certificate has been withdrawn under section 8
section.leadIn: The relevant employer whose exemption certificate has been withdrawn under section 8 shall, as soon as is practicable, provide each member of the ORSO exempted scheme to which the certificate relates with a notice in writing stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the certificate has been withdrawn; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which the withdrawal has taken or will take effect.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Deemed withdrawal of exemption certificate where an ORSO exempted scheme is to cease to be such a scheme
section.leadIn: An exemption certificate shall be deemed to be withdrawn on the date on which a withdrawal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: under section 12 of the relevant Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: of the exemption certificate, within the meaning of section 2 of the relevant Ordinance, issued in respect of the ORSO exempted scheme to which the first-mentioned certificate relates,

section.continued: comes into effect in accordance with section 14 of the relevant Ordinance.

subsection.content: The Authority may issue a proposal to withdraw an exemption certificate where it appears to the Authority that any of the requirements of or under this Regulation applicable to or in relation to the ORSO exempted scheme to which the certificate relates are not, or are no longer, being complied with.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Authority issues a proposal under subsection (1), the Authority shall give a notice in writing of the proposal to the relevant employer of the ORSO exempted scheme to which the proposal relates requiring the employer to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cause a copy of the notice to be sent to each member of the scheme who is a relevant employee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: display an appropriate notice of the Authority’s notice and make the latter available for inspection by such member.

subsection.leadIn: A notice given by the Authority under subsection (2) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state the reason for issuing the proposal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state that representations or objections as regards the proposed withdrawal may be made to the Authority within such period (being a period of not less than 1 month beginning on the date on which the notice is given) as shall be specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may on an application in writing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: withdraw a proposal issued under subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: extend the period referred to in subsection (3).

subsection.content: The Authority may withdraw an exemption certificate if, after considering representations or objections made during the period set out in a notice given under section 11(2), the Authority is satisfied that any of the requirements of or under this Regulation applicable to or in relation to the ORSO exempted scheme to which the certificate relates are not, or are no longer, being complied with.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Authority withdraws an exemption certificate, the Authority shall give a notice in writing of the withdrawal to the relevant employer of the ORSO exempted scheme to which the withdrawal relates requiring the employer to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cause a copy of the notice to be sent to each member of the scheme who is a relevant employee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: display an appropriate notice of the Authority’s notice and make the latter available for inspection by such member.

subsection.leadIn: A notice given by the Authority under subsection (2) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state the decision of the Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state that appeal against the withdrawal may be made to the Appeal Board within 2 months after the date on which the notice is given; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: state the date on which the withdrawal will come into effect.

subsection.content: An appeal under section 35 of the Ordinance against a withdrawal of an exemption certificate may be made by the relevant employer of the ORSO exempted scheme to which the certificate relates within 2 months after the date on which the notice concerned under subsection (2) is given.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Coming into effect of Authority’s withdrawal

subsection.leadIn: A withdrawal under section 12 shall not come into effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where no appeal is made in relation to it under section 35 of the Ordinance, until the period during which such appeal may be made has expired; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where such an appeal is made, pending determination of the appeal or, in case such appeal is withdrawn, before such withdrawal.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Authority withdraws an exemption certificate, in order to afford an opportunity to enable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the requirement of or under this Regulation which caused the Authority to withdraw the certificate to be complied with; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the ORSO exempted scheme to which the certificate relates to be registered under section 18(1) of the relevant Ordinance,

subsection.continued: the Authority may defer the coming into effect of the withdrawal and, if so, shall give a notice in writing of the deferment of the withdrawal to the relevant employer of the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority shall give a notice in writing of the coming into effect of the withdrawal to the relevant employer of the ORSO exempted scheme to which the withdrawal relates requiring the employer to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cause a copy of the notice to be sent to each member of the scheme who is a relevant employee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: display an appropriate notice of the Authority’s notice and make the latter available for inspection by such member.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Certain ORSO registered schemes which are not relevant ORSO registered schemes may be treated as relevant ORSO registered schemes

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may on an application in writing issue a certificate stating that an ORSO registered scheme (not being a relevant ORSO registered scheme) specified in the certificate shall be treated as a relevant ORSO registered scheme if, but only if the Authority is satisfied that— (1 of 2008 s. 19)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the scheme is governed by a trust;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the scheme provides benefits payable on termination of service, death, disability, retirement or winding up; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: all or a class of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the members of the scheme; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the assets of the scheme,

paragraph.continued: have been transferred or will, before or as soon as practicable after the issue of an exemption certificate in respect of the scheme under section 16, be transferred to the scheme from 1 or more relevant ORSO registered schemes.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of the Authority’s power under subsection (1) to issue (or not to issue) a certificate referred to in that subsection, the Authority shall, in exercising his power under that subsection in relation to an ORSO registered scheme, have regard to such of the following as are applicable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether the scheme is a new scheme established as a result of scheme restructuring or bona fide business transactions (including company amalgamation, restructuring and joint ventures);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the scheme was established after the relevant date, whether the members of the original schemes were exempt from all or part of the provisions of the Ordinance by virtue of section 5 of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whether the terms and conditions of the scheme are generally as favourable as the original schemes; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: whether a substantial portion of the members of the scheme comprise or will comprise members of the original schemes.

subsection.content: Where the Authority receives an application under this section, the Authority may require the applicant to supply to the Authority such information or documents (including a legal opinion on a matter specified by the Authority) as the Authority may specify and which is or are reasonably required to enable it to determine the application. (1 of 2008 s. 19)

section.name: s15
section.heading: Existing members and new eligible employees to elect between relevant ORSO registered scheme and MPF scheme

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (5) and (6), the relevant employer of a relevant ORSO registered scheme shall, as soon as practicable after an application has been made under section 16—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of any existing member, not later than—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: 50 days before the relevant date; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: 10 days after he became a relevant employee,

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a new eligible employee, not later than 10 days after the employee became such an employee,

subsection.continued: provide the member or employee, as the case may be, with, subject to subsection (8), the information specified in Part 2 of Schedule 1 in relation to—

paragraph.leadIn: the relevant ORSO registered scheme; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the MPF scheme which the member or employee, as the case may be, is entitled or enabled to become a member thereof by virtue of his employment,

subsection.continued: in the Chinese and English languages.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (5), an existing member shall give notice in writing to the relevant employer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: not later than 30 days—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: before the relevant date; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: after he became a relevant employee,

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: advising the employer that the member elects—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to remain as a member of the relevant ORSO registered scheme; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to become a member of the MPF scheme.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (6), a new eligible employee shall give notice in writing to the relevant employer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: not later than 30 days after the employee became such an employee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: advising the employer that the employee elects to become a member of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the relevant ORSO registered scheme; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the MPF scheme.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (7), an existing member or new eligible employee who fails to make an election under subsection (2) or (3), as the case may be, within the period prescribed under that subsection shall be deemed to have elected to become a member of the MPF scheme and, in any such case, the provisions of the Ordinance and the other provisions of this Regulation shall apply accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (1) and (2) shall not apply in the case of an existing member of the relevant ORSO registered scheme who is required by an enactment of a place outside Hong Kong to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: remain as a member of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make contributions to the scheme in relation to his employment by the relevant employer of the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (1) and (3) shall not apply in the case of a new eligible employee who is required by an enactment of a place outside Hong Kong to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: become a member of the relevant ORSO registered scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make contributions to the scheme in relation to his employment by the relevant employer of the scheme.

subsection.content: Subsection (4) shall not apply in the case of an existing member or new eligible employee to which subsection (2) or (3), as the case may be, does not apply by virtue of subsection (5) or (6) respectively.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, subject to such conditions as the Authority thinks fit, by notice in writing (published in such manner as the Authority thinks fit) waive or modify any of the provisions of Part 2 of Schedule 1 in the case of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a particular relevant ORSO registered scheme specified in the notice;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a relevant ORSO registered scheme belonging to a class of ORSO registered schemes specified in the notice;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a particular relevant employer specified in the notice; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a relevant employer belonging to a class of relevant employers specified in the notice.

subsection.content: The Authority may on an application in writing issue an exemption certificate to the relevant employer in respect of a relevant ORSO registered scheme if the Authority is satisfied that the application and the scheme comply with the requirements of or under this Regulation which are applicable to the application or scheme, as the case may be.

subsection.leadIn: An application under this section shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made by the trustee of the relevant ORSO registered scheme;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: made in such form as may be specified by the Authority;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: accompanied by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the prescribed fee;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a copy of the latest governing rules of the scheme; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: such other documents (including statutory declarations, and documents proving the date of establishment of the scheme) as may be specified by the Authority; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: made before the specified date or such later date as the Authority may specify in writing, either generally or in a particular case or class of cases.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (2), where a relevant ORSO registered scheme (new scheme) is such a scheme by virtue of sections 2(2) and 14, an application under this section shall also be accompanied by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a statement setting out—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the reason for establishing the new scheme; and

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the new scheme is established before the relevant date, a copy of the governing rules of each of the original schemes as those rules were immediately before the respective members of those schemes were transferred to the new scheme; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the documents providing for the transfer, if any, of assets from the original schemes to the new scheme.

subsection.content: Where the Authority receives an application under this section, the Authority may require the applicant to supply to the Authority such information or documents (including a legal opinion on a matter specified by the Authority) as the Authority shall specify which is reasonably required to enable him to determine the application.

Where the Authority refuses an application for an exemption certificate, the Authority shall give a notice in writing of the refusal to the applicant and the notice shall state the reason for the refusal.

An appeal under section 35 of the Ordinance against a decision of the Authority to refuse an application for an exemption certificate may be made by the applicant within 2 months after the date on which the notice concerned under subsection (5) is given.

def.name: SpecifiedDate
def.leadIn: In this section, specified date* (指明日期) means a date specified by the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by notice in the Gazette; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purposes of this section.
