section.name: s17
section.heading: Effect of exemption certificate and mandatory conditions

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the operation of section 3, the effect of an exemption certificate is that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the existing members and new members of the relevant ORSO registered scheme to which the certificate relates, and the relevant employer of the scheme, are each exempt from Part 3 of the Ordinance; (E.R. 1 of 2013)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the scheme, the existing members and new members of the scheme, the relevant employer and the administrator (within the meaning of the relevant Ordinance) of the scheme are each subject to the conditions specified in Schedule 2 which are applicable thereto; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the provisions of Schedule 3 shall apply to and in relation to the trustee, the directors, if any, of the trustee, the assets of the scheme and the person appointed by the trustee to manage the investment of the assets.

subsection.content: The provisions of any specified document applicable to any of the scheme, members and relevant employer referred to in subsection (1) shall not apply to that scheme, those members or that relevant employer, as the case may be, to the extent that any of those provisions are inconsistent with any of the provisions of the mandatory conditions to which that scheme, those members, that relevant employer, as the case may be, are respectively subject.

def.name: SpecifiedDocument
def.leadIn: In this section, specified document (指明文件) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the governing rules of a relevant ORSO registered scheme;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any enactment other than the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any articles of association; or (28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any constitution or rules.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Action to be taken by relevant employer to whom exemption certificate has been issued
section.leadIn: The relevant employer to whom an exemption certificate has been issued shall, as soon as is practicable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: cause the certificate to be exhibited at all times in a conspicuous position at—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: his principal office in Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if there is no such office, each premises where a member of the relevant ORSO registered scheme to which the certificate relates is employed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide each member of the scheme with a copy of the certificate.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Withdrawal of exemption certificate on application by relevant employer

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may on an application in writing withdraw an exemption certificate where the Authority is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the grounds for withdrawal warrant the withdrawal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the certificate is withdrawn, the relevant employer of the ORSO registered scheme to which the certificate relates will not thereby be in breach of the provisions of the Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: An application under this section shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made by the relevant employer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state the grounds for making the application;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be made in such form as may be specified by the Authority; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: be accompanied by such information or documents (including statutory declarations) as may be specified by the Authority.

subsection.content: Where the Authority receives an application under this section, the Authority may require the applicant to supply to the Authority such information or documents (including a legal opinion on a matter specified by the Authority) as the Authority shall specify which is reasonably required to determine the application.
Where the Authority refuses an application to withdraw an exemption certificate, he shall give notice in writing of the refusal to the applicant and the notice shall state the reason for the refusal.

An appeal under section 35 of the Ordinance against a decision of the Authority to refuse an application to withdraw an exemption certificate may be made by the applicant within 2 months after the date on which the notice concerned under subsection (4) is given.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Action to be taken by relevant employer where exemption certificate has been withdrawn under section 19
section.leadIn: The relevant employer whose exemption certificate has been withdrawn under section 19 shall, as soon as is practicable, provide each member of the relevant ORSO registered scheme to which the certificate relates with a notice in writing stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the certificate has been withdrawn; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which the withdrawal has taken or will take effect.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Deemed withdrawal of exemption certificate where relevant ORSO registered scheme is to cease to be such a scheme
section.leadIn: An exemption certificate shall be deemed to be withdrawn on the date on which a cancellation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: under section 45 of the relevant Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: of the registration under section 18 of the relevant Ordinance of the relevant ORSO registered scheme to which the certificate relates,

section.continued: comes into effect in accordance with section 47 of the relevant Ordinance.

subsection.content: The Authority may issue a proposal to withdraw an exemption certificate where it appears to the Authority that any of the requirements of or under this Regulation applicable to and in relation to the relevant ORSO registered scheme to which the certificate relates (including any conditions specified in the certificate) are not, or are no longer, being complied with.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Authority issues a proposal under subsection (1), the Authority shall give a notice in writing of the proposal to the relevant employer of the relevant ORSO registered scheme to which the proposal relates requiring the employer to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cause a copy of the notice to be sent to each member of the scheme who is a relevant employee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: display an appropriate notice of the Authority’s notice and make the latter available for inspection by such member.

subsection.leadIn: A notice given by the Authority under subsection (2) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state the reason for issuing the proposal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state that representations or objections as regards the proposed withdrawal may be made to the Authority within such period (being a period of not less than 1 month beginning on the date on which the notice is given) as shall be specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may on an application in writing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: withdraw a proposal issued under subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: extend the period referred to in subsection (3).

subsection.content: The Authority may withdraw an exemption certificate if, after considering representations or objections made during the period set out in a notice given under section 22(2), the Authority is satisfied that any of the requirements of or under this Regulation applicable to or in relation to the relevant ORSO registered scheme to which the certificate relates (including any mandatory conditions) are not, or are no longer, being complied with.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Authority withdraws an exemption certificate, the Authority shall give a notice in writing of the withdrawal to the relevant employer of the relevant ORSO registered scheme to which the withdrawal relates requiring the employer to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cause a copy of the notice to be sent to each member of the scheme who is a relevant employee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: display an appropriate notice of the Authority’s notice and make the latter available for inspection by such member.

subsection.leadIn: A notice given by the Authority under subsection (2) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state the decision of the Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state that appeal against the withdrawal may be made to the Appeal Board within 2 months after the date on which the notice is given; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: state the date on which the withdrawal will come into effect.

subsection.content: An appeal under section 35 of the Ordinance against a withdrawal of an exemption certificate may be made by the relevant employer of the relevant ORSO registered scheme to which the certificate relates within 2 months after the date on which the notice concerned under subsection (2) is given.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Coming into effect of Authority’s withdrawal

subsection.leadIn: A withdrawal under section 23 shall not come into effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where no appeal is made in relation to it under section 35 of the Ordinance, until the period during which such appeal may be made has expired; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where such an appeal is made, pending determination of the appeal or, in case such appeal is withdrawn, before such withdrawal.

subsection.content: Where the Authority withdraws an exemption certificate, in order to afford an opportunity to enable the requirement of or under this Regulation which caused the Authority to withdraw the certificate to be complied with (including any mandatory conditions), the Authority may defer the coming into effect of the withdrawal and, if so, shall give a notice in writing of the deferment of the withdrawal to the relevant employer of the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority shall give a notice in writing of the withdrawal to the relevant employer of the relevant ORSO registered scheme to which the certificate relates requiring the employer to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cause a copy of the notice to be sent to each member of the scheme who is a relevant employee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: display an appropriate notice of the Authority’s notice and make the latter available for inspection by such member.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Application of provisions of this Regulation in the case of a scheme which is a group scheme under section 67 of the relevant Ordinance
section.leadIn: Where an application under section 5 or 16 is made in the case of an ORSO exempted scheme or relevant ORSO registered scheme, as the case may be, which is a group scheme under section 67 of the relevant Ordinance, then the provisions of this Regulation, with all necessary modifications, shall apply as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the application shall be deemed to be made by each relevant employer of the scheme;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an application under section 8 or 19 by the representative employer shall be deemed to be made by each relevant employer of the scheme;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a duty under section 9, 11(2), 12(2), 13(3), 20, 22(2), 23(2) or 24(3) which is required to be discharged in relation to a member of the scheme shall be discharged by the relevant employer of the member;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a notice given under section 4(8), 5(4), 8(4), 11(2), 12(2), 13(2) or (3), 15(8), 19(4), 22(2), 23(2) or 24(2) or (3) to the representative employer shall be deemed to have been given to each relevant employer of the scheme;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: as if in each of sections 7 and 18 all words after and including “The relevant” were omitted and the following substituted—

quotedStructure.leadIn: “The representative employer to whom an exemption certificate has been issued shall provide a copy of the certificate to each relevant employer of the scheme to which the certificate relates and—(a)each relevant employer shall then, as soon as is practicable, cause the copy to be exhibited at all times in a conspicuous position at—(i)his principal office in Hong Kong;(ii)if there is no such office, each premises where a member of the scheme is employed by the relevant employer; and(b)also provide each member of the scheme with such a copy.”.

subsection.leadIn: A relevant employer who without reasonable excuse fails to comply with— (1 of 2008 s. 45)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any mandatory conditions to which the employer is subject,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.content: The prescribed fees payable under this Regulation are specified in the Fees Regulation.

subsection.def: In this section, Fees Regulation (《費用規例》) means the regulation, if any, made under section 46 of the Ordinance prescribing fees for the purposes of this Regulation.

subsection.content: The Authority may, by notice in the Gazette, amend Schedule 1.
The Chief Executive in Council may, by notice in the Gazette, amend Schedule 2 or 3.
Amendments made under this section shall be subject to the approval of the Legislative Council.

schedule.name: sch1
schedule.heading: Information to be Provided to Existing Members and New Eligible Employees

part.name: P1
part.heading: ORSO Exempted Scheme and MPF Scheme

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to the effect that the existing member or new eligible employee has a once only choice to remain or become a member of the ORSO exempted scheme or to become a member of the MPF scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: advising the existing member or new eligible employee—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: of the date before which that choice must be made; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that if that date passes without the relevant employer having been notified of that choice, the existing member or new eligible employee will be deemed to have chosen the MPF scheme.

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: The following in relation to both the ORSO exempted scheme and the MPF scheme—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: subject to paragraph (b), whether the scheme is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: governed by a trust; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the subject of or regulated by an insurance arrangement within the meaning of section 2 of the relevant Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: whether the law of Hong Kong governs the scheme;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the law of Hong Kong does not govern the scheme, the name of the place outside Hong Kong the law of which governs the scheme;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: particulars of the benefit structure of the scheme, including—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: in the case of a defined benefit scheme within the meaning of section 2 of the relevant Ordinance—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the formula for calculating the amount of a benefit under the scheme;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the income to which that formula applies; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: the required level of contributions, if any, of a member of the scheme;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: in the case of a defined contribution scheme within the meaning of section 2 of the relevant Ordinance, the required level of contributions to the scheme’s funds to be made—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: by a member of the scheme; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: in respect of a member of the scheme;

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: from which a member of the scheme is required to make contributions;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: from which contributions in respect of the member are required to be made; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the portability and preservation of benefits, or the vesting rights, under the scheme.

section.name: s3
section.content: The name of the administrator, within the meaning of section 2 of the relevant Ordinance, of the ORSO exempted scheme.

section.name: s4
section.content: The name of the trustee of the MPF scheme.

section.name: s5
section.content: The rights that an existing member would have under the ORSO exempted scheme if he elects to become a member of the MPF scheme.

section.name: s6
section.content: A statement advising the existing member of the relevant date referred to in section 4(2)(a) of this Regulation.

section.name: s7
section.content: The address and telephone and facsimile numbers of a person who can, on behalf of the relevant employer, respond to any questions the existing member or new eligible employee may have concerning the ORSO exempted scheme and MPF scheme. (E.R. 4 of 2019)

part.name: P2
part.heading: Relevant ORSO Registered Scheme and MPF Scheme

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to the effect that the existing member or new eligible employee has a once only choice to remain or become a member of the relevant ORSO registered scheme or to become a member of the MPF scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: advising the existing member or new eligible employee—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: of the date before which that choice must be made; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that if that date passes without the relevant employer having been notified of that choice, the existing member or new eligible employee will be deemed to have chosen the MPF scheme.

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: The following in relation to both the relevant ORSO registered scheme and the MPF scheme—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether the law of Hong Kong governs the scheme;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the law of Hong Kong does not govern the scheme, the name of the place outside Hong Kong the law of which governs the scheme;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: particulars of the benefit structure of the scheme, including—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: in the case of a defined benefit scheme within the meaning of section 2 of the relevant Ordinance—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the formula for calculating the amount of a benefit under the scheme;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the income to which that formula applies; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: the required level of contributions, if any, of a member of the scheme;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: in the case of a defined contribution scheme within the meaning of section 2 of the relevant Ordinance, the required level of contributions to the scheme’s funds to be made—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: by a member of the scheme; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: in respect of a member of the scheme;

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: from which a member of the scheme is required to make contributions;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: from which contributions in respect of the member are required to be made; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the portability and preservation of benefits, or the vesting rights, under the scheme;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if applicable, the investment choices available to members of the scheme;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the person who bears the investment risk under the scheme;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the name of the trustee of the scheme;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: particulars of the scheme’s administrative costs and the bearer of those costs.

section.name: s3
section.content: The compensation fund coverage for the MPF scheme.

section.name: s4
section.content: The rights that an existing member would have under the relevant ORSO registered scheme if he elects to become a member of the MPF scheme.

section.name: s5
section.content: Illustrative examples to demonstrate the differences in benefits between the relevant ORSO registered scheme and the MPF scheme.

section.name: s6
section.content: The treatment of the accrued rights (as defined in section 2 of the relevant Ordinance) of an existing member of the relevant ORSO registered scheme who elects to become a member of the MPF scheme.

section.name: s7
section.leadIn: Subject to the governing rules of the relevant ORSO registered scheme, the relevant employer’s rights under the scheme to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: reduce benefits or contributions levels for future services;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: close membership of the scheme to new employees;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: withhold benefits under the scheme from a member who has been lawfully dismissed from employment;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: wind up the scheme.

section.name: s8
section.content: A statement advising the existing member of the relevant date referred to in section 15(2)(a) of this Regulation.

section.name: s9
section.content: The address and telephone and facsimile numbers of a person who can, on behalf of the relevant employer, respond to any questions the existing member or new eligible employee may have concerning the relevant ORSO registered scheme and MPF scheme. (E.R. 4 of 2019)

subsection.leadIn: In this Schedule, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: accrued rights (累算權利) has the same meaning as in section 2 of the relevant Ordinance;
defined benefit scheme (界定利益計劃) has the same meaning as in section 2 of the relevant Ordinance;
defined contribution scheme (界定供款計劃) has the same meaning as in section 2 of the relevant Ordinance;

def.name: FinalAverageMonthlyRelevantIncome
def.leadIn: final average monthly relevant income (最終每月平均有關入息), in relation to a member of a relevant scheme, means the member’s relevant income per month averaged over whichever of the following is applicable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the member has been a member of the scheme for not less than 12 months after the relevant date, the period of 12 months (excluding any unpaid leave or maternity leave taken by the member pursuant to any enactment or contract) immediately preceding the earliest of the following— (1 of 2015 s. 53)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date of termination of his employment;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of the winding up of the scheme, the date on which the member ceases to be a member of the scheme;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in the case of the withdrawal (including deemed withdrawal) under this Regulation of the exemption certificate which applies to the scheme, the date of the coming into effect of the withdrawal; or (1 of 2015 s. 53)
the date on which the trustee of the scheme receives the latest claim lodged by the member under section 6(9A) for which benefits have not been paid; (1 of 2015 s. 53)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in any other case, the period (excluding any unpaid leave or maternity leave taken by the member pursuant to any enactment or contract) since the date the member joined the scheme or the relevant date, whichever is the later, to the earliest of the following— (1 of 2015 s. 53)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date of the termination of his employment;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of the winding up of the scheme, the date on which the member ceases to be a member of the scheme;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in the case of the withdrawal (including deemed withdrawal) under this Regulation of the exemption certificate which applies to the scheme, the date of the coming into effect of the withdrawal; or (1 of 2015 s. 53)
the date on which the trustee of the scheme receives the latest claim lodged by the member under section 6(9A) for which benefits have not been paid; (1 of 2015 s. 53)

def.name: MinimumMPFBenefits
def.leadIn: minimum MPF benefits (最低強制性公積金利益), in relation to a member of a relevant scheme, means the lesser of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the member’s benefits accrued and held under the scheme during the period when the exemption certificate applied to the scheme; (1 of 2015 s. 53)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 1.2 × final average monthly relevant income × years of post-MPF service;

subsection.def: relevant income (有關入息), in relation to a member of a relevant scheme, means so much of any relevant income of the member per month which is not more than the maximum level of relevant income per month specified in Schedule 3 to the Ordinance;
relevant scheme (有關計劃) means a relevant ORSO registered scheme to which an exemption certificate issued under section 16(1) of this Regulation applies;
vested benefit (既有利益) has the same meaning as in section 2 of the relevant Ordinance;

def.name: YearsOfPostMPFService
def.leadIn: years of post-MPF service (強制性公積金實施後的服務年期), in relation to a member of a relevant scheme, means the member’s continuous years of service (including part thereof) from the date he joined the scheme, the relevant date or (if the member was previously paid any benefits under section 6(9A)) the date on which the trustee of the scheme received the claim lodged by the member for which benefits were last paid under that section, whichever is the latest, to the earliest of the following— (1 of 2008 s. 18; 1 of 2015 s. 53)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of termination of his employment;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of the winding up of the scheme, the date on which the member ceases to be a member of the scheme;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of the withdrawal (including deemed withdrawal) under this Regulation of the exemption certificate which applies to the scheme, the date of the coming into effect of the withdrawal; or (1 of 2015 s. 53)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the date on which the trustee of the scheme receives the latest claim lodged by the member under section 6(9A) for which benefits have not been paid. (1 of 2015 s. 53)

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 3 applies in the case of a member of a relevant scheme;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the member had benefits transferred from another relevant scheme to the scheme referred to in paragraph (a); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the benefits referred to in paragraph (b) include the member’s minimum MPF benefits,

def.name: MinimumMPFBenefits
def.continued: then, for the purposes of the definition of minimum MPF benefits (最低強制性公積金利益), the member’s benefits accrued and held under the scheme referred to in paragraph (a) during the period when the exemption certificate applied to that scheme shall be deemed to include the minimum MPF benefits referred to in paragraph (c). (1 of 2015 s. 53)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 3, this section shall apply to and in relation to a relevant scheme immediately upon—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the winding up of the scheme; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the coming into effect of the withdrawal (including deemed withdrawal) under this Regulation of the exemption certificate which applies to the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: this section applies to a relevant scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (3), a new member of the scheme (or his beneficiary) is entitled to receive benefits under the scheme (whether immediately or prospectively),

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: as were accrued and held during the period when the exemption certificate applied to the schemes; and (1 of 2015 s. 53)

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: as do not exceed the minimum MPF benefits,

subsection.continued: shall be subject to the provisions of sections 4, 5 and 6.

subsection.content: Section 4(e) shall apply to and in relation to an existing member’s minimum MPF benefits in a relevant scheme as it applies to and in relation to a new member’s minimum MPF benefits in the scheme.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Inter-group transfers and scheme transfers
section.leadIn: Sections 4, 5 and 6 shall not apply to the minimum MPF benefits of a new member of a relevant scheme (existing scheme) upon termination of his employment, or his ceasing to be a member of the existing scheme, where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: he is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: being transferred from one company to another company within the same grouping of companies (within the meaning of section 67 of the relevant Ordinance) and his membership of the existing scheme is transferred to the new employer’s relevant scheme or registered scheme; or

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he did not receive any benefits from the existing scheme; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: his minimum MPF benefits under the existing scheme will be recognized under the scheme to which he is so transferred.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Preservation of minimum MPF benefits
section.leadIn: For the purpose of preserving minimum MPF benefits in a relevant scheme—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: if this section does not apply to the minimum MPF benefits of a new member of the scheme by virtue of section 3, no trustee of the scheme shall transfer or dispose of any part of those benefits except to a relevant scheme or registered scheme referred to in that section;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the governing rules of the scheme shall not enable any person to reduce any new member’s minimum MPF benefits except that the portion of that member’s accrued rights or vested benefits in excess of the minimum MPF benefits may be reduced in accordance with the provisions of the relevant Ordinance;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: no trustee of a scheme shall forfeit a new member’s minimum MPF benefits upon the member’s dismissal from employment (and whether or not dismissal is on the ground of misconduct, fraud, dishonesty or any other ground); and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: the minimum MPF benefits of any new member of the scheme shall not—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: be liable for and stand charged with the settlement of any losses suffered by the relevant employer caused by the new member; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: stand charged with any debts owing to the relevant employer or any other person by the new member (and whether or not such debts are acknowledged in writing by the member).

section.name: s5
section.heading: Portability or transferability of minimum MPF benefits

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 6, where a new member of a relevant scheme is entitled to receive benefits (whether immediately or prospectively) under the scheme, the trustee of the scheme shall transfer, in accordance with the governing rules of the scheme, the minimum MPF benefits of the member as soon as reasonably practicable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a registered scheme in which the member’s new employer is a participating employer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to a master trust scheme or an industry scheme, nominated by the member, that accepts transfers of minimum MPF benefits. (29 of 2002 s. 14)

subsection.leadIn: In the event of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the withdrawal (including deemed withdrawal) under this Regulation of the exemption certificate which applies to a relevant scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the winding up of a relevant scheme,

subsection.continued: the minimum MPF benefits of new members of the scheme shall be—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: calculated as at the date of that event; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: transferred in accordance with the governing rules of the scheme to a registered scheme.

subsection.content: The minimum MPF benefits transferred to a registered scheme pursuant to this section shall be treated as accrued benefits under the scheme and subject to all of the provisions of the Ordinance.
The minimum MPF benefits in a relevant scheme shall not be withdrawn except in accordance with the provisions of this section.

A new member of a relevant scheme who has attained retirement age shall be entitled as of right to have paid to him by the trustee of the scheme the entirety of his minimum MPF benefits in the scheme in a lump sum.
For the purposes of subsection (2), a new member of a relevant scheme shall provide evidence satisfactory to the trustee of the scheme that he has attained retirement age.

A new member of a relevant scheme who has not attained retirement age but has attained the age specified in Schedule 7 to the Ordinance shall be entitled as of right to have paid to him by the trustee of the scheme the entirety of his minimum MPF benefits in that scheme in a lump sum.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (4), the new member of a relevant scheme shall provide, in a form provided or approved by the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a statutory declaration, in the form referred to in section 15(2) of the Ordinance, that he has permanently ceased his employment or self-employment.

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (7) and (8), a new member of a relevant scheme is eligible to withdraw his minimum MPF benefits if he has departed, or is about to depart, from Hong Kong permanently.

A new member of a relevant scheme who has been paid accrued benefits from a registered scheme or minimum MPF benefits from a relevant scheme on the ground that, on a specified date, the member departed, or was about to depart, from Hong Kong permanently is not entitled to be paid the member’s accrued benefits from another registered scheme or minimum MPF benefits from another relevant scheme on the ground that, on a later date, the person purports to have departed, or to be about to depart, from Hong Kong permanently.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (6), a new member of a relevant scheme shall provide, in a form provided or approved by the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: evidence satisfactory to the trustee of the scheme that the new member is permitted to reside in a place other than Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a statutory declaration made by the new member to the trustee that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: he departed, or will depart, from Hong Kong permanently on a specified date; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: he has never before withdrawn minimum MPF benefits from any other relevant scheme or accrued benefits from a registered scheme on the ground of permanent departure from Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: A new member of a relevant scheme is eligible to withdraw his minimum MPF benefits on the ground of total incapacity if he lodges with the trustee of the scheme a claim in a form provided or approved by the Authority together with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a certificate signed by a registered medical practitioner or registered Chinese medicine practitioner certifying that the member is permanently unfit to perform the kind of work that the member was performing for the employer; and (16 of 2006 s. 34)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a letter from the member’s employer certifying that the contract of employment for that kind of work has been or will be terminated.

subsection.name: 9A
subsection.leadIn: A new member of a relevant scheme is eligible to withdraw the member’s minimum MPF benefits on the ground of terminal illness if the member lodges with the trustee of the scheme—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a claim in a form provided or approved by the Authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a certificate that is—

subparagraph.content: signed by a registered medical practitioner or registered Chinese medicine practitioner certifying that, in the practitioner’s opinion, the member falls within subsection (12G); and
dated not earlier than 12 months before the date on which the claim is lodged. (1 of 2015 s. 53)

subsection.content: If a new member of a relevant scheme dies before attaining retirement age, a personal representative of the member, or any other person specified in the governing rules of the scheme for the purposes of this section, may lodge with the trustee of the scheme a claim for payment of the deceased member’s minimum MPF benefits in accordance with those governing rules.

A claim referred to in subsection (10) shall be accompanied by evidence satisfactory to the trustee of the relevant scheme that the claimant is a personal representative of the deceased new member concerned of the scheme or any other person specified in the governing rules of the scheme for the purposes of this section.
The minimum MPF benefits of a new member of a relevant scheme may be withdrawn for making a payment under section 70A of the relevant Ordinance. (4 of 2022 s. 34)

subsection.name: 12A
subsection.content: Subsection (12B) applies if a committee of the estate is appointed in relation to the property and affairs of a new member of a relevant scheme. (1 of 2015 s. 53)

subsection.name: 12B
subsection.leadIn: The committee of the estate may, as if it were the member—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: lodge with the trustee of the scheme a claim for payment of the minimum MPF benefits of the member; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: continue with a claim initiated by the member. (1 of 2015 s. 53)

subsection.name: 12C
subsection.content: Subsection (12B) does not apply in relation to a claim made under subsection (10). (1 of 2015 s. 53)

subsection.name: 12D
subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: committee of the estate (產業受託監管人) means a committee of the estate appointed under section 11 of the Mental Health Ordinance (Cap. 136);
registered Chinese medicine practitioner (註冊中醫) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Chinese Medicine Ordinance (Cap. 549). (1 of 2015 s. 53)

subsection.name: 12E
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, a new member has permanently ceased employment or self-employment if the member—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has ceased all employment with no intention of becoming employed or self-employed again; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has ceased all self-employment with no intention of becoming self-employed or employed again. (1 of 2015 s. 53)

subsection.name: 12F
subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, a new member departs from Hong Kong permanently if the member departs from Hong Kong to reside elsewhere with no intention of returning for employment or to resettle in Hong Kong as a permanent resident. (1 of 2015 s. 53)

subsection.name: 12G
subsection.content: A new member who has an illness that is likely to reduce the life expectancy of the member to 12 months or less has a terminal illness for the purposes of this section. (1 of 2015 s. 53)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsections (9)(a) and (9A)— (1 of 2015 s. 53)

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: a reference to a certificate signed by a registered Chinese medicine practitioner does not include a certificate so signed before the commencement* of section 34 of the Certification for Employee Benefits (Chinese Medicine) (Miscellaneous Amendments) Ordinance 2006 (16 of 2006). (16 of 2006 s. 34)

section.name: s7
section.heading: Treatment of accrued rights of members who join registered scheme

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), the governing rules of a relevant scheme shall provide for the treatment of the accrued rights under the relevant scheme in respect of an existing member who has become a member of a registered scheme as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for a defined contribution scheme—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the accrued rights of the member shall be retained in the relevant scheme and continue to be credited with investment income until he is entitled to receive any benefits from the relevant scheme upon the occurrence of an event specified in the governing rules of the relevant scheme which causes such benefits to be paid; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: if the relevant scheme provides benefits upon termination of service which relate to a member of the relevant scheme’s period of service or age, or any combination thereof, when the member is entitled to receive any benefits from the relevant scheme due to termination of service—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: and period of service only is applicable, both his period of service under the relevant scheme as an existing member and his period of service after he became a member of the registered scheme shall be used in determining his benefit entitlements;

subparagraph.name: B
C
subparagraph.content: and a combination of period of service and age is applicable, sub-subparagraphs (A) and (B) shall apply as appropriate in determining his benefit entitlements; (E.R. 4 of 2019)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for a defined benefit scheme—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the accrued rights of the member shall be retained in the scheme until he is entitled to receive any benefits from the scheme upon the occurrence of an event specified in the governing rules of the scheme which causes such benefits to be paid;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the accrued rights of the member are partly determined by reference to the contributions to the scheme’s fund by or in respect of the member concerned and any declared return in respect of such contributions, the provisions of paragraph (a)(i) shall apply in respect of such accrued rights;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.leadIn: if the scheme provides benefits upon termination of service which relates to a member’s period of service, income or age, or any combination thereof, when the member is entitled to receive any benefits from the scheme due to termination of service—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: and period of service only is applicable, both his period of service under the relevant scheme as an existing member and his period of service after he became a member of the registered scheme shall be used, on a pro rata basis or any other basis approved in writing by the Authority, in determining his benefit entitlements;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: and income only is applicable, both his income when he was an existing member of the relevant scheme and his income after he became a member of the registered scheme shall be used in determining his benefit entitlements;

subparagraph.name: C
D
subparagraph.content: and a combination of any 2 or 3 of period of service, income and age is applicable, sub-subparagraphs (A), (B) and (C) shall apply as appropriate in determining his benefit entitlements.

subsection.content: Where a relevant scheme provides death, disability or any other benefits in addition to any benefits referred to in subsection (1), those first-mentioned benefits of an existing member who becomes a member of a registered scheme shall be determined no less favourably than those second-mentioned benefits which are determined in accordance with the provisions of subsection (1).

The accrued rights of an existing member of a relevant scheme who becomes a member of a registered scheme may be treated otherwise than in accordance with the provisions of this section if the member’s consent has been obtained and it is allowed under the governing rules of the relevant scheme.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Employee’s right upon reduction of future benefits

subsection.content: The governing rules of a relevant scheme shall provide for the situation that, where the relevant employer decides to reduce any member’s future benefits or rights under the scheme, the member is given an opportunity to become a member of a registered scheme.

subsection.leadIn: An opportunity referred to in subsection (1) shall be taken or rejected by a member of the relevant scheme—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: not less than 30 days before the date on which the reduction of the members benefits or rights occurs; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in writing to the relevant employer.

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of an opportunity referred to in subsection (1), the relevant employer of a relevant scheme shall provide all relevant members of the scheme with the information specified in Part 2 of Schedule 1 to this Regulation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to that scheme and the registered scheme to which the opportunity relates; and

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: not later than 50 days before the date on which the reduction of the members’ benefits or rights occurs.

subsection.content: The accrued rights of a member of a relevant scheme who becomes a member of a registered scheme shall be treated in the same way as prescribed under section 7.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Reporting of membership upon implementation
section.leadIn: Within 3 months after the relevant date, the relevant employer of a relevant scheme shall submit the following information to the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the total number of his employees;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the number of employees who are not members of the scheme but are members of a registered scheme;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the number of existing members who have become members of a registered scheme; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the number of existing members who have decided not to become members of a registered scheme.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Filing of annual report
section.leadIn: The trustee of a relevant scheme shall within 6 months after the end of each financial year of the scheme (or within such longer period as the Authority may approve in writing in any particular case) give to the Authority an annual return for that financial year as regards the scheme—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in such form and containing such information as may be specified by the Authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by the prescribed fee.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Reporting of changes to governing rules of scheme
section.content: The trustee of a relevant scheme shall give notice in writing to the Authority of any amendments to the governing rules of the scheme upon submission of any return under section 10 and shall attach a copy of the amendments to the notice.

schedule.name: sch3
schedule.heading: Minimum Standards Applicable to Trustees, etc. of Schemes

subsection.leadIn: In this Schedule, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: actuary (精算師) has the meaning given by section 2 of Part 1 of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (General) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. A); (E.R. 1 of 2013)
associate (有聯繫者) has the meaning given by Schedule 8 to the Ordinance;
derivative (衍生工具) has the same meaning as in Schedule 2 to the Trustee Ordinance (Cap. 29); (E.R. 2 of 2014)

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: in relation to a derivative contract, the nominal value of the investment multiplied by delta;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: in relation to other kinds of securities and investments, the market value;

subsection.def: employer trustee (僱主受託人) has the same meaning as in section 25 of the relevant Ordinance;
market value (市值) has the meaning given by section 2 of Part 1 of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (General) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. A); (E.R. 1 of 2013)
non-employer trustee (非僱主受託人) has the same meaning as in section 25 of the relevant Ordinance;

qualified director (合資格董事), in relation to a company which is a trustee of a scheme, means a director of the company who satisfies the Authority that he has the skill, knowledge, experience and qualifications that are, in the opinion of the Authority, necessary for the successful operation of the scheme;
registered trust company (註冊信託公司) has the meaning given by section 2 of Part 1 of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (General) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. A); (E.R. 1 of 2013)
scheme (計劃) means a relevant ORSO registered scheme to which an exemption certificate issued under section 16(1) of this Regulation relates.

For the purposes of the definition of effective exposure (有效風險) in subsection (1), “delta” is the expected increase or decrease in the market value of the derivative contract given a 1 unit change in the value of the underlying investment. (E.R. 4 of 2019)

section.name: s2
section.heading: Trustees and investment manager to exercise appropriate care, skill, diligence and prudence with respect to the administration of a scheme
section.leadIn: The trustees and investment manager of a scheme shall perform the following duties with respect to the administration of the scheme—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the duty to exercise a level of care, skill, diligence and prudence that may reasonably be expected of a prudent person who is acting in similar capacity and who is familiar with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of a trustee, the administration, management and maintenance of an ORSO registered scheme;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of an investment manager, managing the investment of the assets of an ORSO registered scheme;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a trustee, the duty to use all relevant knowledge and skill, in the administration, management and maintenance of the scheme, that the trustee may reasonably be expected to have in consequence of his business or occupation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of an investment manager, the duty to use all relevant knowledge and skill, in managing the investment of the assets of the scheme, that the manager may reasonably be expected to have in consequence of his business or occupation;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: the duty to act in the interest of the scheme members and not in the trustee’s or investment manager’s, as the case may be, own interest;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the duty to act in accordance with the governing rules of the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: On and after the relevant date, no person shall be appointed to be the investment manager of a scheme except an investment management company that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a corporation licensed to carry on, or an authorized financial institution registered for carrying on, a business in asset management under Part V of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571); or (5 of 2002 s. 407)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is a company authorized by an authority recognized by the Authority to carry on under the law of a place outside Hong Kong the business referred to in paragraph (a). (5 of 2002 s. 407)

subsection.content: Subsection (1) shall not of itself prejudice the efficacy of the appointment of the investment manager of a scheme made before the commencement* of this section.

subsection.leadIn: On and after the relevant date, the trustees and investment manager of a scheme shall ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: derivatives are not used in such a way as to result in the assets of the scheme becoming leveraged thereby;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: money is not borrowed for any of the purposes of a scheme except for the purpose of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: paying accrued benefits to or in respect of scheme members, and then only if—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the amount borrowed is not more than 10% of the market value of the assets at the relevant time; (E.R. 4 of 2019)

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the borrowing is not part of a series of borrowing; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: the period for which the money is borrowed is not more than 90 days; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: settling transactions involving the acquisition or disposal of securities or other investments relating to the scheme, and then only if—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the period for which the money is borrowed is not more than 7 days; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: at the time the decision to enter into those transactions was made, it was unlikely that the borrowing would be necessary.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, the assets of a scheme are leveraged if the effective exposure of the assets exceeds the market value of the assets.

subsection.leadIn: Any trustee of a scheme appointed on or after the relevant date (and whether or not the trustee is described as an alternate trustee, emergency trustee or co-trustee in the governing rules of the scheme)— (14 of 2025 s. 240)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a trustee which is a company incorporated in Hong Kong or a re-domiciled company, must be a registered trust company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a trustee which is a company incorporated outside Hong Kong but is not a re-domiciled company, must satisfy the Authority that— (14 of 2025 s. 240)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it is comparable to a registered trust company;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it has a significant presence and control in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a non-employer trustee who is an individual, must satisfy the Authority that— (14 of 2025 s. 240)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the non-employer trustee is a person of good reputation and character and, in particular, has not been found guilty, whether in Hong Kong or elsewhere, of an offence involving fraud or dishonesty;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the non-employer trustee has the skill, knowledge, experience and qualifications that are, in the opinion of the Authority, necessary for the successful operation of the scheme;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.leadIn: the non-employer trustee has no past or present association (financial or otherwise) with— (14 of 2025 s. 240)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.leadIn: the employer of the scheme otherwise than as—

subparagraph.name: I
subparagraph.content: if the employer is a company, a director of the company; or

subparagraph.name: II
subparagraph.content: a professional adviser;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: any associate of the employer;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: any controller of the employer;

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: any associate of any such controller,

subparagraph.continued: that could affect the impartiality of the trustee’s independent judgment;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the non-employer trustee is not the auditor, investment manager or actuary of the scheme; and

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the non-employer trustee is ordinarily resident in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in the case of an employer trustee who is an individual, must satisfy the Authority that the employer trustee is a person of good reputation and character and, in particular, has not been found guilty, whether in Hong Kong or elsewhere, of an offence involving fraud or dishonesty. (14 of 2025 s. 240)

subsection.leadIn: Any director (and whether or not the director is described as a replacement director of qualified director) of a company which is a trustee of a scheme, other than a trustee to which subsection (1)(a) or (b) applies, appointed on or after the relevant date shall satisfy the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: that he, or another director of the company, has the skill, knowledge, experience and qualifications that are, in the opinion of the Authority, necessary for the successful operation of the scheme.

subsection.content: Where on or after the relevant date, the trustees of a scheme are all individuals, then, upon any retirement of an existing trustee or appointment of a new trustee, there must be not less than 2 trustees of whom not less than 1 must be a non-employer trustee who complies with the requirements of subsection (1)(c).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(b)(i), the company referred to in that subsection is required to be able to comply with section 77(2)(a), (b) and (c) of the Trustee Ordinance (Cap. 29) as if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company were making an application under section 77(1) of that Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each reference to an amount of Hong Kong dollars in section 77(2)(b) and (c) of that Ordinance were followed by the words “or an equivalent amount in any other currency freely convertible into Hong Kong dollars”.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(b)(ii), the company referred to in that subsection—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be a non-Hong Kong company; (30 of 2004 s. 3)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must maintain an office in Hong Kong wherein there is an employee—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: of the company;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: designated by the company as its Hong Kong chief executive officer;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: who ordinarily resides in Hong Kong; and

subparagraph.name: iv

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: must have its day to day business activities relating to its business in Hong Kong—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: conducted wholly in Hong Kong (including the keeping of its records relating to those activities); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if conducted elsewhere, under the supervision and control of the employee referred to in paragraph (b) of the company together with sufficient records relating to those activities kept in Hong Kong to enable any audit required under the relevant Ordinance to be carried out; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: must have sufficient expertise and management resources in Hong Kong to conduct its business in Hong Kong effectively.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Reporting of appointment of investment manager
section.leadIn: Where the trustee of a scheme appoints an investment manager on or after the relevant date, the trustee shall, upon submission of the next annual return thereafter, give notice in writing to the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of the appointment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: of the matters relied upon by the trustee to be satisfied that the investment manager complies with section 3(1)(a) or (b).

section.name: s7
section.heading: Reporting of changes in trustees, etc.

subsection.content: The person who has the duty or power to retire or appoint the trustee of a scheme shall obtain the Authority’s approval in writing before retiring or appointing, as the case may be, the trustee.

subsection.leadIn: The trustee of a scheme which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a company; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not a trustee to which section 5(1)(a) or (b) applies,

subsection.continued: shall obtain the Authority’s approval in writing before retiring or appointing, as the case may be, a director of the company.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority’s approval under subsection (1) or (2) to the appointment of a trustee or director shall be sought by way of an application in writing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made to the Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in a manner and form specified by the Authority, either generally or in any particular case;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by the appointee unless the Authority specifies another person in lieu of the appointee;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: accompanied by the prescribed fee;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: accompanied by a statutory declaration as to the character and suitability of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the trustee where section 5(1)(c) or (d) applies;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the directors of the trustee where section 5(2) applies;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: accompanied by such additional particulars and undertakings as may be required by the Authority.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: An undertaking given to the Authority pursuant to a requirement made under subsection (3)(f) must be by deed, or by a document of like effect acceptable to the Authority. (1 of 2008 s. 10)

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, by notice in writing, exempt—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a person from the requirement of subsection (1)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of a trustee belonging to a class of trustees specified in the notice; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if, and only if, the conditions specified in the notice are complied with;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a trustee from the requirement of subsection (2)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of a director of a company belonging to a class of directors specified in the notice; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if, and only if, the conditions specified in the notice are complied with.

subsection.content: Without prejudice to the generality of conditions which may be specified in a notice under subsection (4), such conditions may provide that the retirement or appointment of a trustee, or of a director of a company, shall become void and of no effect unless and until the Authority approves the retirement or appointment in writing before the expiration of a period specified in the notice. (46 of 2000 s. 40)
